title: How much money can someone make from their first novel which may not necessarily be a bestseller? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s not easy to get your first novel published. Most authors write a second and often a third before they hit a level that is likely to be published traditionally. But if your manuscript does get published, you’re likely to make only a few thousand dollars for it. It’s extremely uncommon for anyone’s book to become a bestseller. Of those that get published, you may see 1/10 of 1% that make it to that status, by any measure. Even books that barely crack that level generally don’t make enough to support a family for a year. Even if you publish 3 or 4 genre novels per year, you may not make enough to support a family in a decent style. And, before you rail about how publishers take all the money, let me tell you that the publishers usually get a contribution margin (to cover overhead and profit) that’s about the same as the author’s royalties. And they’re investing tens of thousands (sometimes hundreds of thousands) of dollars into publishing the book. They are entitled to some return on their money, time, effort and skill.
